TextView.android:text: 1) Create a Daily Activity Schedule \n\nWhen you are feeling disorganized and are not sure what to do, plan out every hour of day with a schedule like this one - https://www.therapistaid.com/worksheets/schedule-behavioral-activation.pdf

2) Anti-Procrastination Sheet \n\nIf the tasks you are doing feel unrewarding, write down why they seem so and put those predictions to the test when you are doing said tasks. The goal is to take a task, break it down into little steps, try to predict how difficult and satisfactory each part of the task will be, and then check in to see how difficult and satisfying the task was in reality. An example sheet can be seen here: http://www.stlouiscounselingandwellness.com/Handouts/Anti_Procrastination_Sheet.pdf

3) Daily Record of Dysfunctional Thoughts \n\nIf you are paralyzed by the urge to do nothing, write down why you feel urge to do nothing (or whatever other automatic thoughts occur) and realize that motivation follows action and not vice versa. A sheet detailing this approach can be seen here: https://deploymentpsych.org/system/files/member_resource/Daily%20Record%20of%20Dysfunctional%20Thoughts-1.pdf

4) Pleasure-Predicting Sheet \n\nWhen you are not feeling like doing things alone, predict the enjoyment you will gain from doing the activity beforehand, then do it and see how you feel after doing it. Also see how being alone or with others impacts the activity. A sheet showing this in practice can be seen here: https://deploymentpsych.org/system/files/member_resource/Pleasure%20Predicting%20Sheet.pdf

5) But-Rebuttal \n\nWhen you find yourself giving excuses for not doing a task, combat those buts with logical and realistic rebuttals until you can feel comfortable actually doing the task and not question your capability about doing so. A sheet showing how to do so can be seen here: http://www.elizakingsford.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/But-Rebuttal-Method.pdf

6) Self-Endorsement \n\nWhen you're feeling like what you do isn\'t worth much, write down the self-downing thoughts and find the distorted patterns in them, while also listing accomplishments you have accrued each day. An example of such can be seen here: http://sourcesofinsight.com/learn-to-endorse-yourself/

7) TIC-TOC Technique \n\nWhen a task is thought about in a self-defeating manner, instead, think about things in a task-oriented way rather than a task-interfering way. An example sheet can be seen here: https://classroommentalhealth.org/exercises/materials/tic-toc-technique.pdf

8) Breaking Tasks Down into Small, Actionable Steps \n\nThis is good for when one is feeling overwhelmed by everything that has to be done during the day. A simple sheet showing this can be seen here: http://www.callistomedia.com/externaldocuments/cbt/CBT_Breaking_Down_Tasks2.pdf

9) Motivation Without Coercion \n\nDo you feel forced to do a lot of the tasks that are in your life? If you are feeling guilty and duty bound, eliminate the shoulds one might throw out when giving self instructions, and try to find the joy in the task in terms of what you want to do, rather than what you must do. To find out more, look here: http://sourcesofinsight.com/coercion-is-a-deadly-enemy-of-motivation/

10) Disarming Technique \n\nIf you are feeling like you are being pressured into something by someone else and are resentful about it, assertively agree with their opinion and tell them you are capable of doing it on your own. To learn more to resist getting pushed around and this technique, check here: http://sourcesofinsight.com/disarming-technique/

11) Can\'t Lose System \n\nWhen you are fearing failure, write down any negative consequences of said failure and adopt a healthy coping strategy ahead of time. https://sourcesofinsight.com/cant-lose-system-8/
